textTemplates.name: EFRR_Action_1
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will educate the client on best practices for a filing system, types of documents to be maintained in various files, and federal and state form retention requirements. 2. HRG will provide the client with Paychex resources to assist in setting up their recordkeeping system, including the Employee File Maintenance chart and the Personnel File Checklist. 3. HRG will provide client with best practices for retaining and auditing employee records, including managing remote employee records and maintaining documents using an HRIS system (HRO).

textTemplates.name: EFRR_Action_2
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will provide client with information on federal recordkeeping requirements (i.e. timelines for retaining employee documents based on type). 2. HRG will research and provide to client state or industry-specific record retention requirements available through validated resources. 3. For industry-specific information on retention period requirements that is not available through these resources, client will contact legal counsel.

textTemplates.name: EFRR_Action_3
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review a sampling of the client’s employee files and alert client to any potential issues such as: missing documents (employment application, job description) and incomplete documents (missing signatures/incomplete sections). 2. HRG will provide documentation best practices (ex. keeping notes from interview on separate paper, rather than on application/resume). 3. Client will use provided Personnel File Checklist to complete a full audit of all of their personnel files and pose questions to HRG on findings or concerns.

textTemplates.name: EFRR_Action_4
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review available Paychex employee forms with client, noting which forms are required or strongly recommended and where each form should go in an employee file. 2. Client will decide what forms will be completed by employees and retained in the client's employee files. 3. HRG will assist client in creating a template employee file using the selected forms.

textTemplates.name: EFRR_Action_5
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will educate client on Form I-9 recordkeeping requirements. 2. HRG will schedule and present the Form I9 Employment Eligibility Verification seminar to the designated contact(s) responsible for completing this form. 3. (PEO Only) HRG and client will review the Paychex PEO client services agreement related to the client's I9 responsibilities. 4. HRG will provide the client with additional I9 resources, such as USCIS's I9 Handbook for Employers (M-274). 5. HRG will review a sampling of the client’s I9 forms and alert client to any potential issues such as: missing documents (if client is keeping photocopies of documents) and incomplete documents (missing signatures/incomplete sections). 6. (PEO Only) HRG will complete a random review of clients’ completed I-9 Forms upon joining PEO service. HRG will complete annual or semi-annual “spot checks” of clients’ I-9 Forms for employees hired since the last review. 7. Client will use provided resources to complete a full audit of all of their I9 forms and pose questions to HRG on findings or concerns. 8. HRG and client will discuss use of HR Online to track I9 document expiration. 9. Client will refer questions regarding authenticity of documents to USCIS or legal counsel.

textTemplates.name: EFRR_Action_6
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will educate the client about the E-Verify program. 2. HRG will provide client with information (state and federal) regarding who is required to participate in E-verify. 3. HRG will provide the client with the link to E-verify and review the steps for enrollment. 4. Client will enroll, take a tutorial, and then take a test before using E-verify with employees. 5. HRG will provide E-verify contact information to the client for additional support.

textTemplates.name: EFRR_Action_7
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will educate client on federal and applicable state document retention requirements for applicants who are not hired. 2. Client will create and maintain internal filing system for retention of documents related to applicants who are not hired.

textTemplates.name: EL_Action_1
textTemplates.text: 1. HR generalist (HRG) and client will review the federal employment laws applicable to the client's business, based on HR Assessment and HRG research.

textTemplates.name: EL_Action_2
textTemplates.text: 1. HR generalist (HRG) and client will review the state and local employment laws applicable to the client's business, based on HR Assessment and HRG research.

textTemplates.name: EL_Action_3
textTemplates.text: 1. HR generalist (HRG) and client will review the available client seminars related to employment laws. 2. HRG and client will create a calendar of seminar delivery based on HRG best practice suggestions and client business need(s). 3. HRG and client will determine the best delivery method (instructor-led, virtual instructor-led, self-directed) for each seminar based on content, locations, schedules, etc.

textTemplates.name: EL_Action_4
textTemplates.text: 1. The client will provide the business's current process for handling employee claims and complaints, if a process or procedure is in place, to the HR generalist (HRG) for review. 2. The HRG will provide training, resources, and best practice information regarding how to receive and respond to employee claims and complaints.

textTemplates.name: EL_Action_5
textTemplates.text: 1. The client will provide the HR generalist (HRG) with a list of locations/worksites where the business has employees. 2. The client and HRG will work together to determine if the correct posters are posted at each site. 3. The HRG will educate the client on how they can handle labor law posters for employees that work remotely, when applicable. 4. The HRG will provide additional or replacement posters as necessary. 5. If the client is utilizing HRO, the HRG will post applicable labor law posters within HR Online for employee electronic access. 6. Client and HRG will conduct an annual poster audit

textTemplates.name: EL_Action_6
textTemplates.text: 1. The HRG will educate the client on the EEO-1 Report and what types of organizations are required to file. The client will make the determination if their business is required to file. 2. If the client is required to file the EEO-1 Report, the HRG will provide the client with education and resources to assist the client with gathering information and completing the report. 3. Client will complete and submit report by the annual deadline of September 30th.

textTemplates.name: EL_Action_7
textTemplates.text: 1. Client will provide a list of states in which they have employees and are employing minors. 2. HR generalist (HRG) will review with client federal and applicable state child labor regulations pertaining to minimum wage; restrictions on time, hours, and duties; work permits; posters and recordkeeping. 3. On an ongoing basis, client will notify HRG when they hire a minor in a new state. 4. On an annual basis, client and HRG will audit client's employment of minors - number of employees and in which states. HRG will obtain this information from client and provide client with new information if applicable.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_1
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will provide client with timeline of handbook process beginning with creating draft copy through handbook rollout. 2. HRG will provide client with copies of Policy Selection worksheet and Interview Preparation worksheet. 3. HRG and client will create schedule to complete handbook project, beginning with meeting to create or review draft copy. 4. Client will complete Policy Section worksheet and Interview Preparation worksheet, and if agreed upon, provide to HRG prior to scheduled handbook draft development meeting.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_10
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review best practices for answering reference check requests with the client's designated individual. 2. HRG will provide the client with resources for answering reference check requests. 3. HRG and client will review applicable handbook policies regarding reference checks and assist client in updating as needed.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_11
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss possible causes of employee turnover with client contact. 2. Client contact will share information they have related to their employee turnover. 3. HRG will show client contact the various resources available through Forms Online to assist the client in identifying the causes of their turnover and aid in reducing it. 4. HRG will discuss best practices for improving employee retention among existing staff, answer any questions the client contact may have, and adjust the Action Plan as needed to add training in areas that may help improve employee retention. 5. HRG will discuss the Paychex Trusted Partnership with BalanceWorks Employee Survey Services and the benefits of surveying current employees. 6. HRG will provide client with the information to contact BalanceWorks Employee Survey Services if the client is interested in using these services. 7. HRG will discuss options for tracking turnover reasons in HRO and benefits of using HRO reports to look for turnover trends.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_2
textTemplates.text: 1. Client will provide HRG a copy of client's current employee handbook and employee count by state. 2. HRG and client will create schedule to complete handbook project, beginning with meeting to review initial draft copy. 3. HRG will create a Paychex handbook draft for the client to review. 4. HRG will explain the difference between a ‘Reviewable’ policy and a ‘Non-reviewable’ policy. 5. Client will determine what policies from their prior handbook they want to include in the new handbook. 6. HRG and client will work together to complete a Paychex Employee Handbook for client employees.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_3_A
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will show client how to access Forms Online. 2. HRG and client will review forms available related to complaint resolution; client will determine which form meets their business needs. 3. HRG and client will educate managers/supervisors on use of forms to include proper documentation techniques and retention as necessary.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_3_B
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will explain purpose of the policy, implications on day-to-day and long-term company culture. 2. HRG will train those identified in the policy on their responsibilities should an employee bring a concern, complaint or suggestion to their attention.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_4
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will educate client on purpose of policies, need for consistency in the organization, and compliance with applicable federal and state laws. 2. If client determines they will offer a policy, the HRG will assist them with policy development.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_5
textTemplates.text: 1. Client will provide HRG with list of states in which they have employees, number of employees in each state, and contact information for at least two company contacts designated to receive complaints. 2. HRG will provide client with Paychex-developed No Harassment policies for approval and use. 3. HRG will educate client on state specific training/posting requirements.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_6
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review the non-harassment training requirements for states the client has employees in with the client contact. 2. HRG will provide high level information regarding anti-discrimination laws of which the client should be aware. 3. Client will share information regarding past harassment and/or discrimination claims/suits as well as any current concerns related to these topics with the HRG. 4. HRG and client contact will develop schedule of training sessions for managers and supervisors on each topic. 5. HRG will deliver training seminars and distribute training resources. 6. Client managers and supervisors will participate in the seminars, sign the Receipt of No Harassment Policy Forms, and provide feedback on Seminar Evaluation Forms. 7. HRG will review additional related online resources with the client contact following the seminar presentations. 8. HRG will provide the client contact with the completed Seminar Acknowledgement Forms, Seminar Evaluation Forms, and Receipt of No Harassment Policy Forms collected from the training sessions. 9. HRG will provide the client contact with Certificates of Attendance for participants. 10. HRG will make additional seminar recommendations to the client contact based on any needs uncovered during training sessions or trainings requested by participants on their Seminar Evaluation Forms.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_7
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review best practice information regarding conducting workplace investigations and individuals to involve in the workplace investigation process with client contact. 2. Client contact will share past workplace investigation experiences and current investigation concerns with the HRG. 3. HRG and client contact will schedule training sessions for identified individuals on Conducting Workplace Investigations. 4. HRG will deliver training seminar and distribute training resources. 5. Client managers and supervisors will participate in the seminars and provide feedback on Seminar Evaluation Forms. 6. HRG will review additional related online resources with the client contact following the seminar presentations. 7. HRG will provide the client contact with the completed Seminar Acknowledgement Forms and Seminar Evaluation Forms collected from the training sessions. 8. HRG will provide the client contact with Certificates of Attendance for participants. 9. HRG will make additional seminar recommendations to the client contact based on any needs uncovered during training sessions or trainings requested by participants on their Seminar Evaluation Forms.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_8
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review the materials with the client contact in advance of the formal presentation to managers and supervisors. 2. HRG and client contact will develop schedule of training for managers and supervisors on this topic. 3. HRG will deliver training seminar and distribute training resources. 4. Client managers and supervisors will participate in the seminar and provide feedback on Seminar Evaluation Forms. 5. HRG will review additional related online resources with the client contact following the seminar presentation. 6. HRG will provide the client contact with the completed Seminar Acknowledgement Forms and Seminar Evaluation Forms collected from the training sessions. 7. HRG will provide the client contact with Certificates of Attendance for participants. 8. HRG will make additional seminar recommendations to the client contact based on any needs uncovered during training sessions or trainings requested by participants on their Seminar Evaluation Forms.

textTemplates.name: ER_Action_9
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review the concept of progressive discipline and best practices related to appropriate uses. 2. HRG will discuss/review available seminar resources: Employee Discipline & Termination Effectively Managing Employees Managing Effective Teams 3. HRG will review available online, writable forms with client: Disciplinary Action Considerations Checklist Problem Solving Record Record of Verbal Warning (writable) Written Warning (writable)

textTemplates.name: ES_Action_1
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will review the states in which the client has employees. 2. HRG will educate the client on the information related to state unemployment insurance and the importance of documentation. 3. HRG and client will discuss best practices for protesting eligibility of unemployment benefits. Information to be provided may be different based on reason for separation and applicable state. 4. For detailed state-specific guidelines, the HRG may refer the client to the Paychex SUIS Department. 5. (PEO) HRG and client will review the specifics of PEO-level vs. client-level reporting, claims processing and hearing participation. This may differ depending upon applicable state.

textTemplates.name: ES_Action_2
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will review the states in which the client has employees, the POA/ROA paperwork the client has completed and submitted, and the paperwork that is still to be completed. 2. HRG will review steps for POA/ROA completion for each state, which may include company information, signatures, notarization, or company letter. 3. Client will provide HRG with POA/ROA paperwork as it is completed. 4. HRG will provide completed POA/ROA to the Paychex payroll and state unemployment insurance departments.

textTemplates.name: ES_Action_3
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will discuss best practices for conducting exit interviews and answer questions client may have. 2. HRG will show client how to access Paychex exit interview resources online. 3. HRG will discuss options for tracking turnover reasons in HR Online. 4. HRG and client contact will review applicable handbook policies regarding exit interviews and update as needed.

textTemplates.name: ES_Action_4
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will discuss best practices for responding to employee reference requests and HRG will answer questions client may have. 2. Client will determine information standards for providing employee reference requests and designate a point person for responding to requests. 3. HRG and client will develop/review client's procedure(s) for this area and update as needed. 4. HRG will assist client in training point person.

textTemplates.name: ES_Action_5
textTemplates.text: 1. Client will provide HRG with a list of employee counts by state. 2. HRG will provide client with applicable state separation requirements and notices. 3. HRG will confirm employee count by state on an annual basis and provide state separation requirements/notices for newly added states.

textTemplates.name: ES_Action_6
textTemplates.text: 1. Client will provide HRG with a list of employee counts by state. 2. HRG will provide client with applicable state-required employee separation paperwork. 3. On an annual basis, HRG and client will review the list of states in which client has employees and update separation paperwork procedures as needed.

textTemplates.name: ES_Action_7
textTemplates.text: 1. Client will provide a list of the states in which they have employees. 2. HRG will provide client with final pay requirements for those states. 3. HRG and client will review final pay requirements with a focus on differences between voluntary termination and involuntary termination. 4. On an annual basis, HRG and client will review list of states in which client has employees and update final pay requirement procedures as needed.

textTemplates.name: ES_Action_8
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will discuss best practices regarding uses of severance agreements and HRG will answer questions client may have. 2. HRG will provide client with a sample severance agreement for client to to gain an understanding of what information is often included. 3. Client will determine if severance agreements may be used and under what circumstances. 4. Client will develop and review each severance agreement and package with a labor attorney before use.

textTemplates.name: ES_Action_9
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client contact will develop schedule for seminar delivery to client's management team. 2. HRG will deliver training seminar and distribute training resources. 3. HRG will provide additional related online resources to management team following the seminar presentation, as needed. 4. HRG will make additional seminar recommendations to the client based on any needs uncovered during training session.

textTemplates.name: NEO_Action_1
textTemplates.text: 1. Client will provide HRG with a list of documents/forms their new hires complete. 2. HRG will discuss with client the required and best practice documentation to be completed with new hires (New Employee information, W4, Form I9, etc. ). 3. HRG will review information related to applicable state and local notice requirements to be provided to new hires. 4. If PEO client, HRG will review the New Employee Packet and educate client on completing the Employer Section.

textTemplates.name: NEO_Action_2
textTemplates.text: 1. The HRG will review best practices, benefits, recordkeeping requirements and use of the new hire checklist with the client. 2. The HRG and client will discuss if/how managers, supervisors, or other personnel will be provided with this information.

textTemplates.name: NEO_Action_3
textTemplates.text: 1. The HRG and client will review the Physical Assets form along with its uses and benefits.

textTemplates.name: NEO_Action_4
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will educate client on the purpose of the employee handbook acknowledgement form. 2. HRG will review Paychex handbook acknowledgement form content and provide feedback if not a Paychex handbook acknowledgement form. 3. HRG will assist client in creating a company procedure for requesting and collecting employee signed handbook acknowledgement forms. 4. HRG and client will develop a form retention system and annual audit process. 5. Client will be responsible to obtain and retain handbook acknowledgement forms from new employees and from current employees when the handbook is updated.

textTemplates.name: NEO_Action_5
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will determine client's needs and wants for a new employee orientation (NEO) program and offer best practice suggestions. 2. HRG will assist client in creating/customizing the NEO program presentation. 3. HRG will train client managers and/or administrators on conducting the new employee orientation program. 4. On an annual basis, HRG and client will review NEO and update as needed.

textTemplates.name: NEO_Action_6
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will educate client on FLSA & state-specific classifications and provide resources to help client classify each position. 2. HRG will educate client on the ADA and the need to identify essential functions and physical demands of a job. 3. HRG will review with client best practices for and benefits of incorporating the job description into the interview process, the new employee orientation program, the performance appraisal process, ADA accommodation requests, Workers’ Compensation injuries/illnesses, performance (discipline) discussions, etc.

textTemplates.name: NEO_Action_7
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss Employment-at-Will and exceptions to Employment-at-Will with the client. 2. HRG will show the client how to access the Paychex-approved sample job offer letter and the language contained in the letter. 3. If client decides to use their own job offer letter or employment agreement, the HRG may look for sample language on Paychex-approved websites to provide to the client as a resource. 4. The HRG will recommend that any employment agreement/contract be reviewed by the client's employment attorney.

textTemplates.name: NEO_Action_8
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review the seminar materials with the client contact in advance of the formal presentation to employees. 2. HRG will schedule the seminar after working with the client to determine an appropriate duration and focus for the seminar. 3. At the scheduled time, the HRG will present the seminar to employees, distribute handouts and materials, have participants sign the Seminar Acknowledgement Form for the client’s records, and distribute the Seminar Evaluation form for participant completion. 4. HRG will provide the client with a Certificate of Attendance for each participant.

textTemplates.name: PaOS_Action_1
textTemplates.text: 1. HR Generalist (HRG) will provide a brief overview of Direct Deposit (DD) and the benefits of Paychex administration to both the client and employees. 2. Client will determine level of interest in signing up for direct deposit service through Paychex and will notify HRG or PRS. 3. HRG or Payroll Specialist (PRS) will provide a more in-depth review of the Paychex DD service and steps for sign-up. 4. (HRG will contact Payroll Specialist and) Payroll Specialist will complete DD setup with client.

textTemplates.name: PaOS_Action_2
textTemplates.text: 1. HR Generalist (HRG) will provide a brief overview of employee garnishments, legal requirements, the Paychex service and the benefits of Paychex administration to client. 2. Client will determine level of interest in signing up for garnishment administration service through Paychex and will notify HRG or PRS. 3. HRG or Payroll Specialist (PRS) will provide a more in-depth review of the Paychex garnishment service and steps for sign-up. 4. Payroll Specialist will complete setup with client. 5. On an ongoing basis, client will send all garnishment orders to Payroll Specialist; garnishments will be processed with each payroll and remitted by the Paychex garnishment department to the appropriate agency.

textTemplates.name: PaOS_Action_3
textTemplates.text: 1. HR Generalist (HRG) will provide an overview of Paychex Online Services. Depending on client type, this will be PaycheFlex or MyPaychex.com/One Source Solutions. 2. Client will determine level of interest in signing up for online services through Paychex and will notify HRG. 3. HRG or Payroll Specialist (PRS) will assist client in completing the necessary paperwork for online services sign-up. 4. Payroll Specialist will process paperwork for setup and notify client when online services are available.

textTemplates.name: PaOS_Action_4
textTemplates.text: 1. Upon completion of setup, client contact will receive training on use of online services. Depending on client type, need, and number of services/products, training may be completed onsite, via WebEx or through written training resources. 2. The Payroll Specialist will provide ongoing client support and training for online payroll and the general online services website(s).

textTemplates.name: PaOS_Action_5
textTemplates.text: 1. HR Generalist (HRG) will provide an overview of Paychex HR Online (HRO) to client contact. 2. Client will determine level of interest in signing up for HRO and will notify HRG. 3. HRG will initiate process for HRO set-up. 4. Upon completion of setup, client contact will be trained on the basic uses and navigation of HRO by the HRO Implementation Coordinator. 5. With assistance, client contact will determine intended uses of HRO, receive additional training in these areas, and customize the site for company use. Depending on client type, assistance will be provided by the HRG or HRO Advisor. 6. When ready, client contact will provide access to HRO to client employees.

textTemplates.name: PM_Action_1
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will discuss the client's current performance review process. 2. HRG will review available performance appraisal forms and resources. 3. HRG and client will work together to build a performance appraisal template (utilizing HRG resources) if the available templates do not meet the client’s needs. 4. HRG will provide the client with blank copies of any performance appraisal templates built. 5. HRG will provide best practice information regarding performance appraisal forms and processes.

textTemplates.name: PM_Action_2
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review with client the benefits of incorporating self/peer evaluations as part of the performance appraisal process. 2. HRG will provide client with standard self/peer evaluation forms.

textTemplates.name: PM_Action_3
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review the materials with the client contact in advance of the formal presentation to managers and supervisors. 2. HRG and client contact will develop schedule of training for managers and supervisors on this topic. 3. HRG will deliver training seminar and distribute training resources. 4. Client managers and supervisors will participate in the seminar and provide feedback on Seminar Evaluation Forms. 5. HRG will review additional related online resources with the client contact following the seminar presentation. 6. HRG will provide the client contact with the completed Seminar Acknowledgement Forms and Seminar Evaluation Forms collected from the training sessions. 7. HRG will provide the client contact with Certificates of Attendance for participants. 8. HRG will make additional seminar recommendations to the client contact based on any needs uncovered during training sessions or trainings requested by participants on their Seminar Evaluation Forms.

textTemplates.name: PM_Action_4
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will discuss client's current practices related to pay increases and review samples of the client's documentation supporting these practices. 2. HRG will provide and review available resource materials related to performance and pay, such as Paychex Management Manuals where appropriate. 3. HRG and client will discuss options for merit-based pay increases and client will make determination on client's preferred approach.

textTemplates.name: PM_Action_5
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will show the client a demonstration of the Performance Review section of HR Online or refer the client to their HR Online Advisor (if applicable). 2. HRG will review the Performance Review template options in HR Online and discuss the option to build a custom template in HR Online. 3. If the client is interested, the HRG will activate HR Online and schedule training with the client regarding access levels, Performance Management, Reminders, and Reporting Structure. 4. HRG will also review with client which elements of People need to be completed prior to utilizing HRO reminders (i.e. email addresses).

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_1
textTemplates.text: 1. HR generalist (HRG) will educate the client on the benefits of job descriptions. 2. Client will provide HRG with an organization chart and list of all position titles. 3. HRG and client will review list of pre-developed job descriptions. (HR Solutions only) 4. HRG will review the job analysis process with client. 5. HRG will provide client with the Job Analysis Questionnaires and if needed, assist with supervisor/employee interviews to solicit feedback. 6. HRG will assist the client with the completion of the Custom Job Description Questionnaire. 7. HRG will educate client on the ADA and the need to identify the essential functions of a job. 8. HRG will review federal and state (if applicable) exemption classification regulations, showing client how to apply them to job description development. 9. For each position, client will determine the FLSA classification (exempt or non-exempt). 10. HRG will review final job descriptions with client. 11. On an annual basis, HRG will assist client with review and updating of job descriptions.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_10
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will assess the client’s needs related to Paychex Employee Screening Service (PESS) or Paychex Background Check Service (BCS) and discuss how the product(s) can benefit the client. 2. HRG will provide and review the PESS/BCS product information with the client, which may include: a. Product Guide b. FAQs c. Sample Reports 3. If the client is interested in utilizing either service, the HRG will assist the client in completing the set-up form or make a referral to Paychex Sales. 4. Client will work with vendor to complete the set-up and utilize PESS/BCS.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_11
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review the disclaimer language on an employment application. 2. HRG will educate client on the utilization of background checks. 3. HRG will educate client on the Federal Trade Commission and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, providing resources as needed. 4. HRG will review applicable state and local restrictions on the timing and types of background checks. 5. (HR Solutions only) HRG will review Interviewing and Selection Manual resources with client.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_12
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will discuss benefits of conducting reference checks on applicants. HRG will educate the client about negligent hiring. 2a. (HR Solutions only) HRG will review Interviewing & Selection Manual resources for obtaining reference checks. 2b. (PEO only) HRG will provide Reference Check list to client and review best practices when conducting reference checks.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_13
textTemplates.text: 1. The client will provide the business's current process for handling non-selection, if a process or procedure is in place, to the HR generalist (HRG) for review. 2. The HRG will review with the client best practices and benefits of using a non-selection process. 3. The HRG will provide the client with sample resources regarding rejection letters and the non-selection process.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_2
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will review client’s existing job descriptions and discuss key components – FLSA status, essential functions, any physical requirements listed, etc. 2. HRG will provide client with any applicable Paychex-approved resources to assist them in best practices with contents of a job description. 3. HRG and client will discuss Paychex Custom Job Description service. HRG will assist client with this development process, if client is interested. 4. HRG and client will review job descriptions on an annual basis.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_3
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will review federal and state compliance information related to employment applications. HRG will provide best practice information related to appropriate and inappropriate questions.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_4
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will show the client the Paychex employment application and review that it is updated periodically for compliance. 2. HRG will show client where the most up-to-date electronic version of the application is located online. 3. If client is interested, HRG will discuss option of customizing the Paychex application with client's logo. 4. HRG will discuss importance of including the Employment-at-Will language on the application.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_5
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review types of interview questions to help client determine what style of interviewing client wants to use. 2. If client is interested, HRG may review the Behavioral Interviewing seminar material with client. 3. HRG will review the available Paychex resources to assist the client in developing standard interview questions. 4. HRG will assist client in developing interview questions using the client's job descriptions and available Paychex resources.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_6
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review the seminar materials with the client contact in advance of the formal presentation to managers and supervisors. 2. HRG will schedule the seminar after working with the client to determine an appropriate duration and focus for the seminar. 3. At the scheduled time, the HRG will present the Hiring Practices seminar to hiring managers, distribute handouts and materials, have participants sign the Seminar Acknowledgement Form for the client’s records, and distribute the Seminar Evaluation form for participant completion. 4. HRG will provide the client with a Certificate of Attendance for each participant. 5. HRG will schedule follow-up appointments with the client as necessary to address related, ongoing items - for example, HRG may conduct the Behavioral Interviewing seminar if the client is planning to use behavioral interview questions.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_7
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review the use of available forms to create and maintain a consistent practice with applicants and avoid potential claims of discrimination. 2. HRG will review Paychex Forms online website with the client to familiarize client with the available recruiting tools: application, Telephone Screening Worksheet, Interview Evaluation Form, Position Requirements Worksheet, etc. 3. HRG will review the Interviewing and Selection Management Manual (HR Solutions only) with the client.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_8
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will discuss client’s recruiting and onboarding needs to see if the client would benefit from any of the available Paychex recruiting, applicant tracking, and onboarding products. HRG will provide an overview of the available Paychex products and services in these areas. 2. If HRG determines that the client will be a good potential fit for any of these products/systems, the HRG will have a meeting with the client decision maker(s) to discuss the features and benefits in more detail. 3. If the client is interested in any of the above-noted products, the HRG will put the client in touch with Paychex Sales.

textTemplates.name: RIS_Action_9
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review best practices and benefits of background screening (employee morale, company reputation, decreased liability, etc.) 2. HRG may discuss areas of concern with not conducting background checks, such as safety, negligent hiring, and turnover. 3. HRG may also discuss best practices, pitfalls, and state restrictions related to social media screening.

textTemplates.name: TD_Action_1
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will explain the difference between a ‘Reviewable’ policy and a ‘Non-reviewable’ policy and the impact adding industry certification information will have on the Employee Handbook. 2. Client will determine which policies need to include industry certification information and will provide that information to the HRG who will update the handbook as necessary. 3. HRG will discuss use of HR Online to track certification renewals, and based on client interest/need, HRG will activate the HR Online product and provide product training.

textTemplates.name: TD_Action_2
textTemplates.text: 1. HR generalist (HRG) and client will review the available client seminars for managers. HRG will also review state requirements for training, such as sexual harassment, where applicable. 2. HRG and client will create a calendar of seminar delivery based on HRG best practice suggestions and client business need(s). 3. HRG and client will determine the best delivery method (instructor-led, virtual instructor-led, self-directed) for each seminar based on content, locations, schedules, etc.

textTemplates.name: TD_Action_3
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review the Paychex Learning Center product with the client and provide the PLC: Client WebEx Recorded Seminar to help client determine interest level. 2. Client will designate a Paychex Learning Center client contact and HRG will activate the Paychex Learning Center. 3. HRG will meet with the client contact and review how to set up the selected users for accessing the PLC. 4. HRG will train the client contact on using, navigating, and assigning training in the PLC. 5. Client contact will complete the PLC Training: Paychex Learning Center Help & FAQs (Client Contact Role). 6. HRG and client contact will discuss any follow up to the PLC training needs for supervisors and/or employees and schedule as needed. 7. HRG will review with client the reports available.

textTemplates.name: TD_Action_4
textTemplates.text: 1. HR generalist (HRG) and client will review the available client seminars for employees. HRG will also review state requirements for training, such as sexual harassment, where applicable. 2. HRG and client will create a calendar of seminar delivery based on HRG best practice suggestions and client business need(s). 3. HRG and client will determine the best delivery method (instructor-led, virtual instructor-led, self-directed) for each seminar based on content, locations, schedules, etc.

textTemplates.name: TD_Action_5
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG and client will review the available leadership seminars. 2. HRG and client will create a calendar of seminar delivery based on HRG best practice suggestions and client business need(s). 3. HRG and client will determine the best delivery method (instructor-led, virtual instructor-led, self-directed) for each seminar based on content, locations, schedules, etc.

textTemplates.name: TD_Action_6
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review the Training, Education, and Skills section of HR Online with client. 2. HRG will demonstrate to client how to track completed trainings and set up expiration dates. 3. Based on client interest/need, HRG will activate the HR Online product and provide product training.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_1
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss the different types of health insurances, the benefits of providing health insurances to employees, and best practices with client. 2. If client is a Paychex Insurance Agency (PIA) client, HRG will partner with PIA account manager to coordinate service delivery. If client is not using PIA, HRG will contact PIA to make referral if client is interested in this service.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_10
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review with client the initial COBRA notice and requirements. 2. Client is responsible for providing the notice to employees and beneficiaries when applicable. 3. If the client is not using the Paychex COBRA Service, the client will provide this notice to employees, as needed. 4. If the client is using the Paychex COBRA Service but is not a Paychex Insurance Agency client for health benefits, the client will notify the Paychex COBRA Department to provide the notice to employees, as needed. 5. If the client is a Paychex Insurance Agency client for health benefits, the Paychex Insurance Agency will provide the notice to the client's employees, as needed.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_11
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what the Paychex COBRA Administrative Service is, the benefits of the service, and the setup process with client. 2. If client determines they would like to utilize the service, HRG will provide the client with the COBRA Administrative Services Setup Kit for completion. 3. HRG will assist client with setup paperwork, as needed. 4. Client will provide completed paperwork to HRG and HRG will submit paperwork for processing.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_12
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what the Paychex Workers Compensation services are and the benefits of each service with client. 2. If client determines they would like to utilize any of these services, the HRG will make a referral for setup. 3. Client will work with the appropriate department to complete setup process, depending on the service. 4. HRG will assist client, as needed.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_13
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what the BalanceWorks EAP is, the benefits of the program, and best practices with client. 2. (PEO) HRG will educate employees on the BalanceWorks EAP program during the Orientation and Annual Enrollment meetings. Information on this program will also be made available to new hires. 3. (ASO) If the client is interested in providing this program to their employees, HRG will work with the client to schedule an employee rollout meeting to review the program. 4. Interested employees will individually contact BalanceWorks using the website or phone number in order to begin using this program.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_14
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss with client workers’ compensation insurance requirements and the need to provide Paychex with a certificate of insurance. 2. On an annual basis, client will be notified of the need to provide an updated COI 30 days prior to coverage expiration. 3. Client will provide Paychex with an updated COI prior to current certificate expiration.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_15
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review with client the basics of employer responsibilities under Healthcare Reform (PPACA). 2. HRG will provide client with information, resources, and updates to Healthcare Reform by directing the client to the Paychex Healthcare Reform homepage.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_16
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review with client the basics of employer responsibilities under Healthcare Reform (PPACA). 2. HRG will provide client with information, resources, and updates to Healthcare Reform by directing the client to the Paychex Healthcare Reform homepage.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_17
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what retirement plans are, the benefits of offering a retirement plan, best practices, and plan options with client. 2. If client determines they would like to offer a retirement plan through the Paychex Retirement Plan Administration service, the HRG will make a referral to a sales representative for setup. 3. Client will work with their sales representatitve to complete plan setup and enrollment process. 4. HRG will assist client, as needed.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_18
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will conduct 401k client contact meeting with client. 2. HRG and client will create a 401k Calendar of Service, including a schedule for quarterly check-ins and an annual employee enrollment meeting.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_19
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review with client what an ERISA bond is and discuss the requirement to have this type of insurance on a 401(k) plan. 2. If client is interested in purchasing a bond through Paychex, HRG will refer the client to the Paychex Insurance Agency (PIA).

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_2
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review information regarding what life insurance is, the benefits of providing life insurance to employees, and best practices with the client. 2. If client is a Paychex Insurance Agency (PIA) client, HRG will partner with PIA account manager to coordinate service delivery. If client is not using PIA, HRG will contact PIA to make referral if client is interested in this service.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_20
textTemplates.text: 1. If the client does not have a retirement plan through Paychex, HRG will refer client to their retirement plan recordkeeper/broker to discuss compliance testing. 2. If client has a retirement plan through Paychex, HRG will review compliance testing during the 401k Client Contact Meeting.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_21
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what the BalanceHealth Wellness program is, the benefits of the program, and best practices with client. 2. If the client is interested in providing this program to their employees, HRG will provide the client with program contact information. 3. Client will contact program vendor.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_22
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what the BalanceHealth Wellness program is, the benefits of the program, and best practices with client. 2. If the client is interested in providing this program to their employees, HRG will provide the client with program contact information. 3. Client will contact program vendor.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_23
textTemplates.text: 1. Client will provide HRG with job titles, descriptions, and other relevant information for positions to be surveyed. 2. HRG will process compensation surveys and review with client.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_24
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review FLSA provisions (minimum wage, overtime, child labor and recordkeeping) with client using the Paychex FLSA seminar. 2. HRG will also provide information related to applicable state laws on compensation.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_25
textTemplates.text: 1. If not completed previously, HRG will review FLSA employee classification provisions with client using the Paychex FLSA seminar. 2. HRG will provide the client with resources related to determining FLSA classification (exempt v non-exempt), such as the "White-Collar Exemption Worksheets." 3. HRG will provide the client with state law information related to worker classification where applicable. 4. Client will make all final determinations related to FLSA classification for each employee/position.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_26
textTemplates.text: 1. If not completed previously, HRG will review information related to students and internships with client using the Paychex FLSA seminar. 2. HRG will provide the client with resources related to determining a student intern exemption, such as DOL Fact Sheet # 71 - determining whether an individual is an intern or an employee by introducing the Department of Labor’s six criteria for a legal unpaid internship. 3. Client will make all final determinations related to student internship exemptions for each individual.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_27
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review worker classifications (employee or independent contractor) with client using the Paychex Independent Contractor or Employee: Classifying Your Workers seminar. 2. HRG will provide information related to applicable state laws for independent contractors. 3. HRG will provide the client with resources related to worker classification, such as DOL Fact Sheet # 13 - determining whether an individual is an employee or independent contractor, and IRS Appendix D - Independent Contractor Test.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_28
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what compensation planning is, the benefits of having a compensation plan, and best practices with client. 2. HRG will conduct the Compensation Planning Seminar with managers and client decision makers. 3. HRG will provide an overview of the Compensation Manual either during the seminar or as a follow-up meeting. (ASO Only) 4. HRG will review other resources to assist client with compensation planning.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_3
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what short-term disability and long-term disability insurances are, the benefits of providing STD/LTD insurances, and best practices with client. 2. (ASO) If client is a Paychex Insurance Agency (PIA) client, HRG will partner with PIA account manager to coordinate service delivery. If client is not using PIA, HRG will contact PIA to make referral if client is interested in this service.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_4
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what employee-paid supplemental insurances are, the benefits of providing them, and best practices with client. 2. (ASO) If client is a Paychex Insurance Agency (PIA) client, HRG will partner with PIA account manager to coordinate service delivery. If client is not using PIA, HRG will contact PIA to make referral if client is interested in this service. 3. (PEO) If client is a Worksite Solutions client, HRG will partner with Worksite Solutions representative to coordinate service delivery. If client is not using Worksite Solutions, HRG will contact Worksite Solutions to make referral if client is interested in this service.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_5
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what the Working Advantage program is, the benefits of the program, and best practices with client. 2. (PEO) HRG will educate employees on the Working Advantage program during the Orientation and Annual Enrollment meetings. Information on this program will also be made available to new hires. 3. (ASO) If the client is interested in providing this program to their employees, HRG will work with the client to schedule an employee rollout meeting to review the program. 4. Interested employees will individually register using the website or phone number in order to begin using the discount program.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_6
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what the BalanceCare program is, client eligibility, the benefits of the program, and best practices with client. 2. (PEO) HRG will educate employees on the BalanceCare program during the Orientation and Annual Enrollment meetings. Information on this program will also be made available to new hires. 3. (ASO-PIA) HRG will work with client’s PIA account manager to coordinate service delivery.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_7
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what a Section 125-POP plan is, the benefits of providing a Section 125-POP plan, and best practices with client. 2. If the client is interested, HRG will provide client with setup paperwork for the client to complete. 3. Upon initial setup, HRG will provide/review relevant plan documents and resources with client. 4. Client and client employees will complete the necessary forms. 5. Client or HRG will submit copies of completed form(s) to the payroll specialist for processing and client will retain completed forms on file. 6. After first payroll run on the POP plan, client will review payroll journal for accuracy and discuss any discrepancies with payroll specialist.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_8
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will discuss what Section 125-FSA/HSA plans are, the benefits of each, and best practices with client. HRG will also discuss the Paychex Benefit Account product. 2. If the client is interested, HRG will make a referral to Paychex Sales. 3. Upon initial setup of PBA, HRG will provide/review Section 125 regulations, relevant plan documents and resources with client. 4. Prior to first payroll run on PBA, HRG and client will review reports for enrollment accuracy. 5. After first payroll run on PBA, HRG and client will review reports for accuracy of deductions.

textTemplates.name: TRCB_Action_9
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review with client the debit card option that is included with Paychex Benefit Account FSA/HSAs. 2. If client is interested in moving to PBA to take advantage of the debit card option, HRG will make a referral to Paychex Sales.

textTemplates.name: WS_Action_1
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review with client the available safety service offerings: Dedicated Safety Representative OSHA Compliance Assessment Safety Management/OSHA Compliance Manual Development OSHA/Safety Training Resources Ongoing Safety Consultations 2. HRG and client will discuss client's immediate needs related to development of a safety program. 3. HRG will refer client to the Paychex Safety Services Department and a dedicated Safety Representative will contact client to begin development of a safety program.

textTemplates.name: WS_Action_2
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review with client the available safety training resources. 2. HRG and client will discuss client's immediate needs related to development of a safety training schedule. 3. HRG will refer client to the Paychex Safety Services Department and a dedicated Safety Representative will contact client to begin development of a safety training program/schedule.

textTemplates.name: WS_Action_3
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will educate the client on the basic OSHA safety requirements for employers. 2. HRG will refer client to the Paychex Safety Services Department and a dedicated Safety Representative will contact client to review OSHA safety requirements in more depth: OSHA Compliance Assessment Safety Management/OSHA Compliance Manual Development OSHA/Safety Training Resources

textTemplates.name: WS_Action_4
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will educate the client on the basics of accident/injury management. 2. HRG will refer client to the Paychex Safety Services Department and a dedicated Safety Representative will contact client to review accident/injury management in more depth.

textTemplates.name: WS_Action_5
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will educate the client on the basics of Emergency Preparedness. 2. HRG will refer client to the Paychex Safety Services Department and a dedicated Safety Representative will contact client to review Emergency Preparedness in more depth and begin development of a plan: Safety Management Manual Development Ongoing Safety Consultations

textTemplates.name: WS_Action_6
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review with client the available safety resources related to Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) requirements: Dedicated Safety Representative OSHA/Safety Training Resources Ongoing Safety Consultations 2. HRG will refer client to the Paychex Safety Services Department and a dedicated Safety Representative will contact client to discuss PPE requirements and resources based on client's industry, equipment, and position responsibilities.

textTemplates.name: WS_Action_7
textTemplates.text: 1. The client will provide the HR generalist (HRG) with a list of locations/worksites where the business has employees. 2. The client and HRG will work together to determine if the correct safety posters are posted at each site. 3. The HRG will educate the client on how they can handle safety posters for employees that work remotely, when applicable. 4. The HRG will provide additional or replacement posters as necessary. 5. If the client is utilizing HRO, the HRG will post applicable safety posters within HR Online for employee electronic access. 6. Client and HRG will conduct an annual poster audit

textTemplates.name: WS_Action_8
textTemplates.text: 1. HRG will review with client OSHA recordkeeping requirements and the available related safety resources. 2. HRG will provide client with OSHA recordkeeping forms, tools, and resources based on client need. 3. HRG will refer client to the Paychex Safety Services Department as needed and a dedicated Safety Representative will contact client to discuss the clients specific OSHA recordkeeping needs in more depth.
